title: Don't talk about champions being bad and in need of buffs/reworks unless you play them
body:
Do not base your assertions simply because of numbers/changes you saw on the patch notes

if you like to be audible about champions you don't play, you are creating more problems.

You are the reason why post-rework Ryze was initially buffed. **Twice.**

thank you.

replies.body:
I agree. 

They are the reason high skillcap champions like {{champion:121}} {{champion:107}} {{champion:238}} are trash tier now.

> [{quoted}](name=M Schumacher,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WdQLEnbK,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-07-18T16:51:29.659+0000)
>
> I agree. 
> 
> They are the reason high skillcap champions like {{champion:121}} {{champion:107}} {{champion:238}} are trash tier now.

Rengar and zed arent horrid or anything Kha'Zix is kinda though

> [{quoted}](name=ShuffledPancake,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WdQLEnbK,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-07-18T16:52:19.960+0000)
>
> Rengar and zed arent horrid or anything Kha'Zix is kinda though

Have you played Zed recently? His ult nerf made him COMPLETELY useless late game. Not only do they just {{item:3157}} your ult you get blown up instantly whenever you use it because of the stupid delay on returning to his shadow.

> [{quoted}](name=M Schumacher,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WdQLEnbK,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2015-07-18T16:56:00.766+0000)
>
> Have you played Zed recently? His ult nerf made him COMPLETELY useless late game. Not only do they just {{item:3157}} your ult you get blown up instantly whenever you use it because of the stupid delay on returning to his shadow.

You realise Zed has a great early and mid game - put enemy behind, they dont get zhonyas - easy game.. anyway its 3 am here.. night

> [{quoted}](name=ShuffledPancake,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WdQLEnbK,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2015-07-18T16:59:07.637+0000)
>
> You realise Zed has a great early and mid game - put enemy behind, they dont get zhonyas - easy game.. anyway its 3 am here.. night

Name one advantage of playing Zed over Annie that isn't "MOBELITY!!!1".

> [{quoted}](name=NERDSMASHER5000,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WdQLEnbK,comment-id=00000000000000000001,timestamp=2015-07-18T17:02:10.870+0000)
>
> Name one advantage of playing Zed over Annie that isn't "MOBELITY!!!1".

Safety in lane, lack of reliance on Flash to do... anything and decent splitpushing. Also, can be picked alongside stuff like Ryze top without making your team too easy to itemise against.

Annie is weak to being pushed to tower, if you clear waves faster than her then she ends up under tower losing farm. If she maxes her W to help her waveclear then she loses the good poke that her Q would give, plus forcing her to keep using her abilities on waveclear makes her run oom and waste her stuns. Zed on the other hand is essentially resourceless and can get good waveclear and poke in one move.

Then you can roam while she's waiting for the tower to clear the wave, and her tower goes down faster. Pretty much every champion in the game aside from the hyper scalers lose out on having their waves pushed to tower.

> [{quoted}](name=NERDSMASHER5000,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WdQLEnbK,comment-id=00000000000000000001,timestamp=2015-07-18T17:02:10.870+0000)
>
> Name one advantage of playing Annie over Zed that isn't "MOBELITY!!!1".

Annie has a massive stun, single target guaranteed stun etc - you asked for reasons OVER zed, if i do the opposite its - High early game dmg - great mid game dmg - high juke potential STILL, Original post was fine and truthful the rest - garbage

> [{quoted}](name=ShuffledPancake,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WdQLEnbK,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2015-07-18T16:59:07.637+0000)
>
> You realise Zed has a great early and mid game - put enemy behind, they dont get zhonyas - easy game.. anyway its 3 am here.. night

His early and mid game aren't "great" and any AP that knows how to play the game rushes Zhonyas and makes Zed useless
and that AP user had better have some great inbuilt sustain because you just spent 3k gold on something that doesn't help you stay in lane at all.

Khazix is very much in line with his theme of "Consume and adapt"
He consumes the nerfs that riot gives him
Then his playerbase adapts so that he is op again.
Kha is actually pretty great after the last buff to his isolation
Skill _cap_ has very little to do with it, and the skill _floor_ on those champions isn't anywhere near as high as most people pretend it is.
lol those three champions are fine right now
not really kha but rengar and zed are fine

"Zed lacks counterply, his decent waveclear involves using his only escape but I still complain about both, his Qs are impossible to dodge because I stand in melee range as Orianna, he kills me at level six because I got hit by all three Qs and I ulted the air and I never built a zhonyas all game, but instead I built nashors because pwoerofevil did it, rito ploz nerf"

> [{quoted}](name=UltraSceptile,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WdQLEnbK,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-07-18T16:57:13.464+0000)
>
> "Zed lacks counterply, his decent waveclear involves using his only escape but I still complain about both, his Qs are impossible to dodge because I stand in melee range as Orianna, he kills me at level six because I got hit by all three Qs and I ulted the air and I never built a zhonyas all game, but instead I built nashors because pwoerofevil did it, rito ploz nerf"

Are we really going to pretend Zed isn't one of the easiest champions to play during the laningphase with huge snowball potential?
Zed did lack counterplay, since no matter how good you are. He can always sit at hit turret for 10 minutes easily farming waves with his abilities. Either the numbers would get nerfed or he'd get more counterplay like they did. Eitherway zed mains would cry.

I know this poster.
He was the same guy in another thread that said upgrading trinket is for noobs lmaooooooooo

> [{quoted}](name=NERDSMASHER5000,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WdQLEnbK,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-07-18T16:47:07.260+0000)
>
> Do not base your assertions simply because of numbers/changes you saw on the patch notes
> 
> if you like to be audible about champions you don't play, you are creating more problems.
> 
> You are the reason why post-rework Ryze was initially buffed. **Twice.**
> 
> thank you.

I don't know man,people who are constantly under fear of being wrong end up doing nothing instead,is that really better?

Let's say that I see a champion(who I never play),with a low pickrate+a healthy kit(as in,not evelyn,fucking toxic broken garbage),which consistently gives me the impression of a weak champion(Also maybe I have friends who play it and say it to be weak,may or may not be the case),I'm going to upvote every buff thread for that champion(not the rework ones though).

Why? the way I see it,I'm more likely to be right than I am to be wrong,and if I'm right a champion who is weak will be placed in a better spot,however,if I'm wrong a champion who has been considered weak for a long time will get more attention,since his kit is healthy even when too strong he won't be too obnoxious,and after he is nerfed into a good spot people will remember he exists and you will have a healthy champion seeing more play,so more variety.

It's a win-win really.

>Don't talk about champions being bad and in need of buffs/reworks unless you play them

There's little point to it anyways.  Riot doesn't take balance advice from players, we are ALL biased in this.
Riot has the numbers to look at.  K/D/A, pick/ban rate, win/lose rate, cs rate, typical build rates, average AD/AP built, crits, heals, cc, ect.  They look at the numbers and go from there, in that way they can keep things much more unbiased and fair.

Why doesn't Riot take advice from players?
Ask yourself this, why was Riot so hesitant to nerf {{champion:64}} for so long?


... you have your answer.

> [{quoted}](name=Kuroi86,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WdQLEnbK,comment-id=000d,timestamp=2015-07-18T22:38:30.924+0000)
>
> There's little point to it anyways.  Riot doesn't take balance advice from players, we are ALL biased in this.
> Riot has the numbers to look at.  K/D/A, pick/ban rate, win/lose rate, cs rate, typical build rates, average AD/AP built, crits, heals, cc, ect.  They look at the numbers and go from there, in that way they can keep things much more unbiased and fair.
> 
> Why doesn't Riot take advice from players?
> Ask yourself this, why was Riot so hesitant to nerf {{champion:64}} for so long?
> 
> 
> ... you have your answer.

Riot was hesitant to nerf Lee Sin for so long because they listened to players who were clearly biased and wrong, rather than listen to the other 50% of the community that had no fun for like 5 years.

So, kinda a bad example, both sides were loud as all heck. This is more of an example of why not to listen to **REDDIT.**
Mostly because lee win became an idol to some players to the point of the community creating giant backlash. Google "ghostcrawler lee sin" if you think I'm kidding.

I have, it wasn't pretty.  He was so beloved to so many people Riot actually feared what would happen should they nerf him and because of it a rework that could have saved him from the constant nerfs was scrapped and instead Riot had to slowly nerf him down here and there until his hold on the jungle finally slipped.

>Riot had to slowly nerf him down here and there until his hold on the jungle finally slipped.

He's coming back you know? Give it a month and Lee/Rek'sai will be the only two junglers ever seen competitively.

Unless Lee's 100% countered by the meta like he was when Cinderhulk was in its prime he's always going to be a top pick. 

His kit's is one of the most overloaded of any champion in the game, why wouldn't he be a great competitive pick?

Two months, currently you've got Devourer thinking that champs like {{champion:11}} {{champion:10}} and {{champion:24}} are a good option.
The truth is, Lee was never countered, he was simply nerfed until he became unpopular, he's still strong, you just have to know what you're doing instead of just blowing people up at the beginning of the game.
The fighter meta died because people actually thought that tanks were buffed sufficiently to beat it.
Any fighter jungler will still out duel any tank early game save for {{champion:32}}.
Won't be long, I'll be back to using {{champion:80}} jungle and possibly using {{champion:28}} bruiser jungle instead of assassin.

> Two months, currently you've got Devourer thinking that champs like {{champion:11}} {{champion:10}} and {{champion:24}} are a good option.

Only in solo que. In competitive play late game carry based junglers have always been bad. The only devourer junglers I'd expect to see in the competitive scene are Nocturne and Shyvana as they are the two who actually can create pressure at level 6 and they actually scale better into a bruiser role off of jungle gold than any of the champs you listed.

> The truth is, Lee was never countered, he was simply nerfed until he became unpopular, he's still strong, you just have to know what you're doing instead of just blowing people up at the beginning of the game.

Lee Sin isn't unpopular. He's the most picked solo que jungler and about the 5th most popular competitive jungler right now (after Grag, Rek, Eve and Nid). 

He wasn't nerfed out of play at all. His last nerf was in patch 4.20, when the new jungle items were released. And that's not Cinderhulk, it's Warrior/Juggernaut/Magus/Devourer. Lee fell out of play entirely off the back of Cinderhulk being introduced and creating more "come back potential" for Lee's opposing junglers.

> Any fighter jungler will still out duel any tank early game save for {{champion:32}}.

Almost any fighter jungler will beat almost any tank jungler early game including Amumu. Amumu's not even the strongest duelist of the tank junglers early game, Gragas and Cho'gath are both far better in early duels than he is.

Early game pressure isn't what makes tanks strong though. A good player on a tank jungle will simply out path you and you never really get a chance to duel them.
Neither of them will be top tier when {{champion:76}} is a viable option

Not only that, but asking for nerfs about champions you haven't played either. That's the most annoying part of it IMO. Most people say {{champion:92}} is OP, they just don't know how to play against her. These are the same Rivens I stomp as goddamn {{champion:75}} (Happened 3 times this season in ranked), and with many other champions, even against those that use animation cancelling.

I wouldn't call that a hard matchup imo. Pretty much all of Riven's kit is aoe and people who aren't that good of Riven players will push the wave into your tower allowing you to safely farm under tower getting those stacks.

> [{quoted}](name=CastawayTomHanks,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WdQLEnbK,comment-id=000c0000,timestamp=2015-07-19T02:45:55.103+0000)
>
> I wouldn't call that a hard matchup imo. Pretty much all of Riven's kit is aoe and people who aren't that good of Riven players will push the wave into your tower allowing you to safely farm under tower getting those stacks.

Or the Rivens who spam spells, with their logic behind it being ''Well its up and i don't use mana anyways''. Funny thing is I actually got this response from a gold this season.

Believe it or not some Plat+ players do that too. I was watching wings stream and he was playing against a riven who was doing exactly that and he man handled her early game as trynda as he was explaining that. Rivens that spam Q and their shield will create so many opportunities for you to trade with her or all in her when she can't really do anything about it.

That wasn't the reason why post-rework Ryze was initially buffed.

People tried out the new Ryze in a few games and thought he was trash, and that was why he was buffed.

It wasn't until after his buffs that people saw how broken his new snare was when maxed first since no one was maxing it first. Everyone was probably maxing his Q first because that's what they did before the rework, and look at what he became.

Then again, I do agree with your statement. You don't know how good or bad something is until you try it out in-game, including items.

> [{quoted}](name=Kamquats,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WdQLEnbK,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2015-07-18T18:27:52.225+0000)
>
> That wasn't the reason why post-rework Ryze was initially buffed.
> 
> People tried out the new Ryze in a few games and thought he was trash, and that was why he was buffed.
> 
> It wasn't until after his buffs that people saw how broken his new snare was when maxed first since no one was maxing it first. Everyone was probably maxing his Q first because that's what they did before the rework, and look at what he became.
> 
> Then again, I do agree with your statement. You don't know how good or bad something is until you try it out in-game, including items.

it was though

morons played him once and spammed "skillshot 40% winrate gutted GG" and then he got absurd buffs when he was already ridiculous

But people didn't realize that he was ridiculous after he got buffed.

People weren't doing W max first until after he got buffed because they always maxed Q first before the rework, and players thought that would be best after the rework too.

Even then you probably shouldn't talk about it unless you're good enough to balance an entire game with literally thousands of variables. Tons of people say crap like "balanced" or that is so op when in all reality it is just the other player getting beaten by someone using a kit properly. Usually if players use the kit correctly, there is always going to be a one sided battle since, in an equal skill situation, one champion is going to either be weaker or stronger than their opponent.

The only time I would simply assume how powerful the champion is when I have genuinely seen them enough in game, or their statistics strongly support that claim.
Otherwise, I am in full agreement with your statement.

{{champion:82}} 
needs some love nothing too much
his early game is simply too punishing for that late game fantasy that he never will have since he is a mid-game champ

id like to see a test patch were morde no longer has any health costs but riot is too scared of the big metal guy

Why? I never played Veigar, but I played against him a few times after his changes, and I felt so sad that I just pointed out he needed buffs.

Just because I don't play the champion myself doesn't mean I can't tell when he's been nerfed beyond common sense and requires buffs.

> [{quoted}](name=Silven,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WdQLEnbK,comment-id=001f,timestamp=2015-07-19T22:54:16.641+0000)
>
> Why? I never played Veigar, but I played against him a few times after his changes, and I felt so sad that I just pointed out he needed buffs.
> 
> Just because I don't play the champion myself doesn't mean I can't tell when he's been nerfed beyond common sense and requires buffs.

He's fine I feel. One vote for buff, one against. Neither of us probably have the level or deduction required to balance this game so it doesn't really matter.

I mean right after he got the cage changes. He was terrible then.

Now, of course, I feel like he's in a quite decent spot.
bring old karma back {{item:3070}}

I've played:

Tristana = needs tweaks for her AA, buffs for AP part, maybe add some AD scalling for R
Elise = needs some serious love with buffs. Like immediately...
Veigar = Eehhh.. he's kind of... eh... OK'ish? otta fix his dark matter to be more reliable without stun
....
Did i miss something?
Oh Right
Cassiopeia = rework that piece of Stashu. But this time, as poison mage.
Rework Warwick pls {{item:3070}}
Personally I think you should judge a person's post by the content in the post, not the person themselves. But hey, it's what all the cool kids do.

{{champion:17}} Short range (kinda) mage that effectively has no ultimate after the support hits level 9
{{champion:82}} Also short range and no way to stick to his target despite being a burn mage

I'd like to add an addendum; don't call a reworked champion shit when you keep trying to play them like they still have their old kit. The whole point of a rework is to force a champion to play differently, and if you're still trying to play Veigar like a pick mage instead of a teamfight oriented control mage, you're going to have a bad time. Old Veigar was basically an alternative version of Syndra; new Veigar is far more similiar to Anivia. If you try to play Anivia like you're playing Syndra, of course you're going to have a bad time.
Completely agree, gain actual knowledgeable facts, then open your mouth untill then keep it shut.

So, I'm entitled to talk about changes to Karma, Veigar, and Soraka. Sounds good to me.

(PS, I don't think any of them are in a bad spot really. Karma is pretty good right now, and Soraka is nicely niche. Veigar is also pretty decent and is a good niche pick).
